intro: Gynoxys flexopedes, commonly known as the Mexican moonseed, is a member of the Menispermaceae family. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically orange or red in color. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
